bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States.
Monrovia, October 1, 1891.

Mr Beverly Y. Payne,
To the Department of State.
Accounts and Returns for the quarter ended September 30, 1891.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, October 1, 1891.
Hon., William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington, D.C.
I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith, the Accounts and returns of this Consulate General, for the quarter made September 30th 1891, as per subjoined list of Enclosures.

I have the honor to be,
Sir:
Your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne,
U.S. Vice Consul Gen.

1. Digest of the Invoice Book.
2. Arrival and Departure of Am Vessels
3. Record of Notarial service.
4. Summary of business.
5. Record of Treasury fees.
6. General quarterly account.
7. Abstract of Contingent Expense & vouchers (5)
